reviewText:
相当有意思的小游戏，画风好可爱，音乐也好有感觉，还可以玩合作，不知道为什么玩的人这么少。
今天心情本来不是那么好的，玩玩这游戏感觉好多了，曾经入过一次包，好像是Humble的。
这游戏操作很简单，玩法很多样，有时候还要考虑如何才能多combo得高分，很有乐趣。各种combo还有食物链的设定，很有意思~
好友里虽然有28个人有这游戏，可是只有8个人玩过。
这游戏我给满分 10/10，能治愈人的游戏，给人一种放松感，大家可以试试哦~

reviewText:
From the creators of Superbrothers Sword & Sworcery comes one of my favorite puzzle games. It was the first game I bought on Steam and I went in not knowing what to expect. It is the definition of pleasant surprise. I found myself having giggle-ragefits and fistpumping at creating awesome chains. I love everything about it. I love the humor, the art, the diverse mechanics, the puzzles, and its surprising amount of depth. I don't say this often but it's worth it full price. I honestly cannot think of a flaw unless you hate cute things. The story is one you rarely see in a game: You're Biggs and you're trying to be a good father to your starving kid. Your goal is to keep the island free of cute critters and vomit rainbows into your child's mouth to keep him fed while a human traveler discovers new things about your homeland! The information he uncovers is pretty interesting.

It has online multiplayer capability, single player, and has a leaderboard for people who really wanna challenge themselves and score massive combos. The online multiplayer has Co-Op and Versus mode, both very fun to play with friends. The single player mode offers an Adventure, Puzzles, Challenges, and unlockable Survival modes. For one puzzle type, you're given a number of moves to get rid of all the critters. If you deplete those moves and the critters aren't gone, you'll be mobbed by a flurry of adorable creatures. Succeed and you can proceed to more difficult levels.

I enjoyed the crap out of this game and I strongly recommend it to anyone who loves puzzles, cute things, and/or something to sit back and relax to. Not enough peoploe play this game and I cannot recommend it enough.

8.5/10

reviewText:
Gameplay: Each campaign world introduces a new mechanic, gently expanding Critter Crunch's basic puzzle premise into a diverse field of interactions. The variety of special critters and abilities produces a deep optimization exercise. I had great fun with the puzzle and challenge levels - they encourage studying move consequences that would otherwise go unnoticed in the frenzy of clearing the board.

Controls: Generally quick and responsive, which is ideal for what becomes a twitch puzzler at high levels. However, I wish it took the same time to interact with critters regardless of screen position. Waiting for Biggs' tongue to extend for high-hanging critters needlessly breaks the flow/pacing.

Presentation: The atmosphere of Critter Crunch is beautiful - smiling sprites, vibrant colors, and upbeat tunes. Biggs has so many animation frames that it's fun to pause the game to see what expression the little fellow has at that instant. Funny storyline, definitely the most enjoyable ending within this genre!
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
9/10 - Critter Crunch at first glance might look like just another puzzle game. With the rows of creatures having similarities, it might even seem like a match 3 puzzler. But its not! In fact, its a quite unique spin on the genre. Instead of matching like objects, you will instead use the critters as a food chain of sorts.

In Critter Crunch, you play the role of Biggs, a puffy orange and white looking creature who looks like he would fit right at home in a Nintendo game. He's cute, he's adorable, and he has a big appetite for gems. As Biggs, you will be running back and forth on the screen grabbing critters, and rearrangfing them or ultimately feeding them to each other. Smaller critters feed the critters one size up from them. 2 critters, or a stuffed critter, will make the bigger critter explode, releasing gems for Biggs to eat. There are in the spirit of these type of puzzle games, special objects to help or hurt you in the game, as they appear as pieces throughout the rows. For instance, bombs may appear, which can clear out a section of critters. Biggs' son even pops up if you clear a chain of 8 critters, allowing for a huge score boost. All in all, very fun puzzle mechanics in this title.

What's more is that this game looks gorgeous. Probably the nicest looking puzzle game I have come across on Steam. It's not popping with particle effects, or 3D. Instead, it chooses a hand drawn high res sprite look, that you would expect to see in a game like Rayman Origins for example. the animations for Biggs are wonderful also. The game is very colorful, but not in a seizure inducing sort of way. Everything just looks extremely crisp, and smooth.

Buy this game!

reviewText:
I love this game ^^
It has been a while since a puzzler managed to captivate me. Now this game not only looks great (of course the manga style, cuteness and humor is not everyone's taste, in this case I personally really like it), it is also one of the very few puzzlers with some new ideas, and they even work brilliantly. In the first few levels you might think the mechanics are too complicated for fast-paced puzzle thrills, but it's actually all quite simple and you'll get the hang of it quite quickly (plus the Adventure Mode slowly shows you all the different critters and power foods). When you're through adventure mode, there are still dozens of puzzle levels (very cool, btw!), challenge levels (very tricky, btw!), the survival mode (that's what these games are all about in the end, right?) aaaand then there's local and online Co-op and versus modes...the only set back: There is hardly ever anyone online! Why doesn't anyone seem to know about this game? Totally underrated! The only things that bug me a bit are that there's no indication of when the row goes down and that survival mode is over a little fast because it gets tough rather quickly.
Anyway, get it and let's have a match :]

8.5/10

reviewText: Great puzzle game. I have had no problems with the port. If you want to play multiplayer, it's a bit empty. :/ Let me know if you want to play a match.
Starts out simple enough as these games tend to do, gets more complex and harder as it goes. Nice puzzlegame.

This game is everything that I hoped it would be. Local co-op with a friend is excellent and we are currently ranked in the 60's. Local versus is a blast. The Xbox 360 controller works like a charm. And by using a program called DS4 Windows my friend is able to use his PS4 controller too. The graphics are exactly what the preview shots look like, somewhat anime-ish with painted backgrounds. I really like it. Music is great. The critters drop down slow at first but if you can survive then the game really does pick up pace, or there is a button you can press to make the rows drop faster. There are a bunch of funny items and tricks to learn. I recommend playing adventure mode first to learn how the game works. But it's also pretty fun to go into local co-op and versus blind with your friend and figure the game out together. Right now we are playing through adventure mode by taking turns and helping one another out (also yelling at each other and making dirty jokes). It's been hilarious. I want it to never end. But even after the main game is completed there are puzzle and challange modes, and always the faithfully entertaining versus and co-op.

Just when you thought you had seen all the puzzle games out there, along comes Critter Crunch that manages to be cute and do something different all at the same time.
The game is being presented as some sort of silly documentary, with a host telling you all about the main character, Biggs. The goal is simple; feed Biggs. To do this you have to eat small creatures, spit them out into bigger ones, eat those and spit these out into even bigger ones. After that, you have to collect the crystals that drop. That's right, Biggs eats crystals. While it all sounds fairly simple so far, it really is not. Each level introduces a new rule or gameplay mechanic, making it increasingly more difficult, but also keeps it challenging and fresh.
Oh, the game has some lovely, colorful 2D graphics, by the way. It really fits the game's theme.
I don't even have to say this game is worth it... Oh wait, I just did (gently press Add To Cart and follow the instructions...).

[Rating: 77/100]

reviewText:
This is a very pleasant and addictive game. Very simple in its rules, the learning curve is just right to keep enjoying the game.
Each main level has 3 sub-levels and at least one of each sub-level from the puzzle and challenge modes.
Puzzle gets you to clear the level with x number of moves and challenge mode asks you to achieve an objective within a time limit.
Great to play with friends as games are very quick and can be both co-operative and player-vs-player.

reviewText:
It's a cute little game, unique too. You feed a critter twice and it'll pop any critter of it's same color in a chain. To feed a critter have to go from small to large. There are power-ups that can be eaten by any critter size.

Eventually the game gets difficult and becomes more punishing. You have to think fast and react quick later on. Eventually it does get rather tedious but does throw in a few new mechanics as you go in deeper. There are puzzles too that'll leave you head scratching and attempting many times.

I haven't had any experience with multiplayer though.

This game is okay. It wasn't until I described the game to someone that I realised how ridiculous the concept is. You are a fuzzy creature you feeds insect to each other until they explode and drop crystals, oh and you vomit rainbows over another fuzzy creature for no discernible reason. The silliness is part of the charm of the game, also the visual style is very cute and the underlying gameplay is sound. The problem is there is just too much going on, you start off with the basic insects and it is great fun. Then you get more and more types of insects until you no longer have time to weigh up the different possible moves in time. The best parts of the game are the puzzle levels where you have a limited number of moves and no time constraint. I started to find the main levels an annoyance between me and the next puzzle level. So yes there is fun to be had here but it is not one that going to keep me playing for hour after hour.

Critter Crunch is a charming puzzle game with fresh mechanics and a unique presentation. There is a story mode, various challenges, and multiplayer versus and co-op modes. Like most puzzle games, this will be most enjoyable with friends, but the gameplay is varied and interesting enough to keep you hooked. This is the definitive version of the game and one of the best puzzle games on Steam. Buy this!

reviewText: This game is weird.\n\nCute, but weird.

Okay, I have no idea why I got this game, whether a humble bundle, sale or whatever. But it is way more fun than it has a right to be. The character style is very anime-like, which I like, and the humor is tongue-in-cheek on the game's entire premise. The mechanics are different than any other coming-down-from-top, pop-the-bubbles/whatever game that I have seen. Instead of shooting matching bubbles from the bottom, you grab a critter" from one column and spit it out in another. Your goal is to pop the critters by over-feeding them and gobbling up the crystals that come out (which is another running tongue-in-cheek gag). Sometimes if you get a large enough chain
date: you get to barf rainbow juice into your son's mouth for bonus points. I'm only about 4 main levels in
recommended: and each new mechanic they have added has been interesting without being too hard to pick up.\n\nProbably my only dislike so far is that I can't find a way to restart a puzzle level without just wasting all my moves and waiting for the critters to come beat up the main character (which was amusing the first couple times
voteText: and that the only way to advance through the screens (like tutorials
votesHelpful: etc) is to click on a mildly-small button in the bottom right. Just a little hard to hit it quickly after being used to the fast reactions in the levels."

reviewText: This game is ridiculously cute.  From fast-paced challenges to puzzles that make you think, there are plenty of different modes and levels to keep you playing.  I could happily feed critters and puke rainbows all day. The levels can range from easy to very hard and some may even make you want to rage quit. However in adventure mode you only need to complete 3 per area to unlock the next set and once the other modes are open you can always skip levels and leave the harder ones for later. Overall I think there's plenty of challenge and gameplay for your money and if it's on sale it's a no-brainer for any puzzle fan.

It's a matching puzzle game with several twists; you aren't merely match coloured grubs together but you are feeding smaller critters to larger ones making them explode in over consumption and all their adjacent friends of the same colour. It's wacky, adventure mode slowly throws new elements at you as the game progresses so you get used to the mechanics, there are versus and co-op modes and it's obcsencely cute. It reminds me of Magic Drop... if you played that game, I can just recommend based on comparable nature.

Critter Crunch is a game that feels japanese to me.  From the high fun factor to the crritters crapping crystals this gem will keep you entertained for hours.

You play a hairy, fat, frog-like blob that force-feeds small creatures, into fatter/bigger creatures, to over-feed them so they explode and you can eat their tasty, crystal-encrusted guts. So delightfully evil, but so cute.
Super cute puzzle game packed with a decent amount of challenge.

The little critter you play as (literally) throws up rainbows into his children's mouths to feed them - and you get a bonus for doing so. Your eyes will melt along with your heart after 5 minutes of playing this. Once you start to think about crossbreeding a pomeranian with a chinchilla - then you know you can take a short breather.
It's a fun and cute puzzle game will some of the coolest artwork i've seen in a game!\n\nand lets face it, anything that regurgitate rainbows is an auto win :)
fast action,  critical thinking involved.. keeps you entertained the whole time..

While the player base is (and tragically remains) consistently small, this is an excellent game that is highly challenging and yet still quite fun. If you like matching puzzlers, this is an cheap and fun game. Be forewarned, since the player base is so small acquiring any online challenges is a bit hard. Its best to do versus matches against friends (such as me.. if you get it please do so. I am almost done with the main game but have only gotten to play a few matches. Any time with a friend to challenge would make the online multiplayer badge significantly easier)
Surprisingly good puzzler with adorable characters and very addicting gameplay!

This is a great game that is well worth the price. The animation is cute and colorful, and the game is fast-paced and fun.  There is a good amount of levels and some different gameplay modes that keep the game interesting. Multiplayer is mostly dead but you can always play with a friend.
fast action,  critical thinking involved.. keeps you entertained the whole time..
played aproximately 100 hours of this in the PS3. charming, fast and precise, if you get this send me a message for us to play online!
Now that this is on PC I don't really have reason to boot my PS3.

A wonderful waste of time :)
The cutest way to eat animals. It's similar to Tetris, but very fun and has a cutely funny story.

This is the best puzzle game ever created. Well designed, cute, funny, and challenging.
If you like games like the ones made by Pop Cap, this one is for you.

I bought it when it released on PSN back in 2009, still play it to this day. Bought it again on PC, still plan to play it forever.
I always highly recommend this game to people. It is a must own!
Yes, it is insanely adorable, but it's a good game, too! It's trickier than it looks at a glance.\nVersus mode is especially fun. Co-op is great.\nWarning: This game is seriously addicting.

A glorious masterpiece of the highest order; A triumph in the art of the interactive co-operative competitive video games, combining both innovative non-linear puzzle solving in a introspective science akin to Einstiens' solutions, an impressionist art style connoting an adversity to modern Nihilism and embracing the existiential doctrines of Nietzsche and an interactive experience almost as far reaching and entertaining as Farming Simulator 2014.

Started as a Disney game, the style shows it. But Capybara (Superbrothers: S&S EP) gave it a wonderful twist.

Puzzle game, you eat critters ala Yoshi then spit them out so other critters eat them. When the critters eat so much that they explode, little crystals fall down and you eat the crystals. Eventually, you barf rainbows into your son's mouth.

I usually don't like puzzle games, but my usual frustrations don't surface cause dawww this game is just so cute :3

He does a little dance, look at that little dance.

A fun, light hearted puzzle game. Offers a lot of variety until the the end of the ~6.0 hour campaign with a lot of extra challenged and puzzles afterwards too. The game itself has a good mix of strategy and casual gameplay. It's really satisfying to setup the board and then clear the whole thing in one move. Has colorful artwork and a good sense of humor as well.
Disgustingly cute Skittles-flavored barfing...
Now that this is on PC I don't really have reason to boot my PS3.

Basically the most adorable, addictive, candy-coated, colorful puzzle game around. It's already way cheap for the weekend's worth of fun the main story provides, and if you love competative puzzlers local and online multiplayer can add tons of replayability to it.\n\nWorth every penny, and when it's on sale it's a darn steal.

Sorta like Magical Drop but kinda assholish. Play single-player for a while before going online because you will encounter new pieces that you have no ♥♥♥♥ing clue about will show up without warning and then you lose because ♥♥♥♥ HOW DO I POP THIS".\n\nIt's not bad and the leaderboards/competitive modes are pretty fun though

Great puzzle game to waste a few minutes or several of hours with, depending on the spare time you have. Certainly a game that's suited for adults (considering the increasing difficulty) and children (considering the animation, colours, multi-player mode and level of cuteness). Adorable, easy-going game-play!

reviewText: This game is weird.\n\nCute, but weird.

I'm usually not a big fan of this type of puzzle game at all, but I am absolutely addicted to this for some reason. Cute, humorous, somewhat challenging, plus online multiplayer(though I have yet to try MP.) CHeap little time waster well worth the coinage.

This game is ridiculously cute.  From fast-paced challenges to puzzles that make you think, there are plenty of different modes and levels to keep you playing.  I could happily feed critters and puke rainbows all day. The levels can range from easy to very hard and some may even make you want to rage quit. However in adventure mode you only need to complete 3 per area to unlock the next set and once the other modes are open you can always skip levels and leave the harder ones for later. Overall I think there's plenty of challenge and gameplay for your money and if it's on sale it's a no-brainer for any puzzle fan.

cuteness overload!
made me hate garlic, mushroom, and milk, especially if my opponent gets them.

10/10 would rage on my friend for stunning my biggs again. love it.
Great game, equal parts fun, funny, challenging and entertaining. The art was beautiful, the mechanics are user friendly... I suggest it.

I got this game to play with my wife.  She likes it, so I like it.

We play it with USB DDR Dance Pads.

I just wish the adventure mode was full co-op.  Multiplayer consists entirely of either one verses mode or co-op mod.  Would like some form of cooperative progression
Such a cute and gross little games. A fun littel point and click puzzle game for killing a little time.

This game is interesting in a weird way. Honestly I'm not sure what to think of it. Honestly I think it's kind of morbid that the creatures go through the food chain especially when they are so happy and scared at the same time. This would probably also fit in the side thumb category.
Its so cute!! The artwork is adorable, and the game is fun and there so many fun aspect to it. If there's ever a 2nd one, I;m so getting it!

I owned this on the PS3 and was pretty happy to see it come to PC, and it plays about the same.

This game kind of plays like an... inverse Super Puzzle Fighter?  Creatures come down from vines, and you feed them to each other to pop chains of like critters, with upward-falling combos, chains of fed critters, and special cirtter types to spice of the action.  The aesthetic is charming and is a wonderfully strong aspect of this game.

The game features a 'story' mode to introduce you to the game mechanics, a puzzle mode, score attack mode (with online coop possible), a challenge mode, and an online versus mode.   The online versus is likely not thriving but if you can get a few friends (like me since you're reading my review!) to play with you, you're probably set.

Pretty fun, I'd reccomend picking it up.
